channel.title: What should I do with a dynamo?
channel.description:
[URL=http://img50.imageshack.us/img50/4985/dsc00767k.jpg][IMG]http://img50.imageshack.us/img50/4985/dsc00767k.th.jpg[/img][/URL]
Got one of these from an old bike.
Also, it generates AC, how can I change it into DC if I want to power something that needs DC? of course, assuming I make it turn in the first place, deciding what the power is easy compaired to that.

item.title: What should I do with a dynamo?
item.dc:creator: @newbiehacker newbiehacker
item.description:
@newbiehacker wrote:

sppt:

At the topic of converting AC to DC, isn’t that just using diodes or am I mistaken?

4 diodes will give you a fully rectified signal, but you then need smoothing stages by using capacitors, etc. And if you’re planning to use it for anything a voltage regulator is also a must (although the chances of you blowing anything is slim, it’s better to be safe than sorry)

Read full topic
item.source: What should I do with a dynamo?

Anyone know what the % efficiency these things are?

item.title: What should I do with a dynamo?
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

use it to generate power while you masturbate
use it to generate power for your laptop while you walk
use it to knock someone out
hook it up in reverse and use it as a drill

Read full topic
item.source: What should I do with a dynamo?

item.title: What should I do with a dynamo?
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:8, topic:290141”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=383529.msg2880316#msg2880316 date=1248301710]

maybe it was a failed assumsion that it gives AC, i assumed it because the magnet is rotating and the coil is fixed, that gives AC i think.

That is how an alternator in a car works, fixed coil, spinning magnet, and it most definitely puts out DC.

I still have one of those things on my bike though, and they power a regular flashlight battery, which is also DC. If I were you I’d just put it on a bike.
[/quote]

:eek: How dare you! Everyone knows that the purpose is to use things they were never intended for! I’m sure a few people on mitb could give examples (I can’t think of any :()[/quote]

Any prescription medication, most household cleaners, and any other everyday object really.

Read full topic
item.source: What should I do with a dynamo?

item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

maybe it was a failed assumsion that it gives AC, i assumed it because the magnet is rotating and the coil is fixed, that gives AC i think.
[/quote]

That is how an alternator in a car works, fixed coil, spinning magnet, and it most definitely puts out DC.

I still have one of those things on my bike though, and they power a regular flashlight battery, which is also DC. If I were you I’d just put it on a bike. :)[/quote]

:eek: How dare you! Everyone knows that the purpose is to use things they were never intended for! I’m sure a few people on mitb could give examples (I can’t think of any :()

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

yakman:

maybe it was a failed assumsion that it gives AC, i assumed it because the magnet is rotating and the coil is fixed, that gives AC i think.

That is how an alternator in a car works, fixed coil, spinning magnet, and it most definitely puts out DC.

I still have one of those things on my bike though, and they power a regular flashlight battery, which is also DC. If I were you I’d just put it on a bike.
